comment: We end this chapter with an astonishing example showing that even world class masters may be troubled by over eagerness to exchange. In this example it amouns to chess blindness. This seems to have been a bad day for both these Grandmasters; it occasionally happens to all of us. At times like this we know we are likely to make wrong decisions at critical moments, and for want of inspiration it is only natural to make exchanges automatically .Such must have been the circumstances which produced the following remarkable sequence of moves
reasoning: The comment suggests a potential lapse in strategic thinking due to over-reliance on exchanges.
